alert.note: Alert for Mesa (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 9:27PM MDT until July 31 at 11:15PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Colorado, including the following counties, Delta and Mesa. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 927 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Central Delta and Central Mesa Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
